errors.error_description: The Python version badge ambiguously states '3+' instead of the specific supported version '3.11', which could lead to users trying to use incompatible Python versions.
The installation command `pip install -u rlberry` is incorrect. The flag `-u` is not a valid flag for upgrading a package; the correct flag is `-U` or `--upgrade`.
correction_candidates: pip install rlberry
pip install --upgrade rlberry
pip install rlberry --update
pip install -U rlberry

errors.error_description: The URL for the logo image is incorrect, pointing to 'logo.svg' instead of 'logo_wide.svg', which results in a broken image link.
correction_candidates: Change the image source to 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rlberry-py/rlberry/main/assets/logo_wide.svg'.
Change the image source to './assets/logo_wide.svg'.
Change the image source to 'https://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry/blob/main/assets/logo_wide.svg'.
Remove the logo image tag from the README.

errors.error_description: The installation instructions incorrectly include a preliminary step to install a non-existent package `rlberry-core`. This command will fail as the package is not on PyPI.
correction_candidates: Change `pip install rlberry-core` to `pip install rlberry[core]`.
Remove the line `pip install rlberry-core` and its preceding text.
Combine the two commands into `pip install rlberry-core rlberry`.
Replace `pip install rlberry-core` with `pip install git+https://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry.git#subdirectory=core`.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the line `pip install rlberry-core` and its preceding text.

errors.error_description: The instructions suggest creating and activating a virtual environment *after* installing the package, which is the incorrect order. This leads to a global installation rather than an isolated one.
correction_candidates: The current order is correct for a system-wide installation fallback.
Remove the suggestion to use a virtual environment.
Move the instructions for creating and activating a virtual environment to before the `pip install` command.
Replace the `venv` instructions with `conda` environment commands.
errors.golden_answer: Move the instructions for creating and activating a virtual environment to before the `pip install` command.

errors.error_description: The BibTeX citation block is malformed. There is a missing closing brace `}` for the `author` field, which will cause parsing errors in citation managers.
correction_candidates: Replace the entire BibTeX block with a plain text citation.
Add a closing brace `}` after the last author's name and before the comma.
Remove the comma at the end of the `author` line.
Change the BibTeX entry type from `@misc` to `@software`.
errors.golden_answer: Add a closing brace `}` after the last author's name and before the comma.

errors.error_description: The command provided to install from GitHub, `pip install git://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry.git`, uses an incorrect protocol `git://`. The correct format for pip is `git+https://`.
correction_candidates: git clone https://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry.git && cd rlberry && pip install .
pip install https://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry/archive/main.zip
pip install git+https://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry.git
pip install from-git https://github.com/rlberry-py/rlberry.git

errors.error_description: The README suggests installing an old version of NumPy (`<1.20`) for compatibility, which is likely to cause dependency conflicts with `rlberry` and other modern libraries.
correction_candidates: Update the command to `pip install "numpy>=1.21"`.
Remove the note and the command suggesting to downgrade NumPy.
Change the command to `pip install numpy --upgrade`.
Keep the note, as older NumPy versions are required for certain legacy systems.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the note and the command suggesting to downgrade NumPy.
